content: flight of the advent crochet feather flight of the advent crochet feather dk & sock these crochet feathers work up quickly and provide a great way to use small amounts of yarn you re likely to be left with after putting your advent calendar to use use any color you want pair 2-3 scraps experiment with stripes whatever you do it s going to be beautiful consider using them individually as keychains bookmarks etc include them along with tassels on the ends of a scarf or shawl or join lots them together for a full project made of feathers i d love to see your creations © 2024 jay s fiber studio 1 flight of the advent crochet feather yarn & hook you ll follow the same pattern for either dk or sock weight yarn with dk obviously resulting in a larger feather gauge is not important below is my hook recommendation but choose what feels right to you yardage varies but the maximum you should need for a single feather if worked as the large version is 25 yds dk weight us h/8 5 00mm sock weight us f/5 3 75mm substitutions if you wish to use a different yarn weight you should be able to follow the pattern instructions with an appropriate hook size however note that both the finished size and required yardage will vary notes if you plan to join multiple feathers together or attach them to something else leave long tails to use as you join the work otherwise you can weave in your ends and it s ready to go blocking is completely optional the pattern is the same for both yarn weights but you re able to choose a small or large version both versions begin the same but where the small feather begins decreasing you ll continue another increase section for the large version abbreviations & definitions chain chain blo back loop only bp back post shown as bphdc back post half-double_crochet back is always the side facing away from you regardless of right side or wrong side fp front post shown as fphdc front post half-double_crochet front is always the side facing toward you regardless of right side or wrong side half_double_crochet half-double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet 2 together decrease sc3tog single_crochet 3 together double decrease sl slip st s stitch es special stitches incdec place a single_crochet into the appropriate stitch starting in the same stitch work the first incomplete single_crochet for a sc3tog decrease complete the sc3tog as usual across the next 2 stitches decinc work a sc3tog decrease as usual across 3 stitches in the last stitch worked into the sc3tog place a single_crochet © 2024 jay s
